questions.question_text: Which of the following refers to the steps to be taken if an issue occurs during a change implementation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. is correct. Also since is the most updated and last question as of july I made a discord to discuss exams, the goods, and etc. Drop discord below for an inv. Will check every so often!

Selected Answer: B
Whenever a failure occurs during a change plan execution, a rollback procedure is invoked to undo changes executed so far and abort the ongoing change plan.

Selected Answer: B
B. Soft token

Soft Token: A soft token is a form of multifactor authentication that typically involves a software application generating a one-time password (OTP) on a user's device. Soft tokens are often cost-effective compared to hardware tokens (like smart cards) and can be easily implemented without the need for additional physical devices.

questions.question_text: A help desk technician determines a motherboard has failed. Which of the following is the most logical next step in the remediation process?

choices.B: Verifying warranty status with the vendor

questions.question_text: A user added a second monitor and wants to extend the display to it. In which of the following Windows settings will the user most likely be able to make this change?

discussion.content: I always just right click on the desktop then click display settings. But of course Comptia wants you to take an extra step and go through System.

Selected Answer: A
lect Start > Settings > System > Display works

Selected Answer: A
Make sure your cables are connected properly to the new monitors, then press Windows logo key + P to select a display option. If you need more help, here's what to do: Select Start > Settings > System > Display. Your PC should automatically detect your monitors and show your desktop.

comments.content: This is not correct, customizing your desktop can be done in personalization but extending a monitor needs to be done in display settings which is found in system.
Incorrect.. its A, System. Try it yourself.. Go to settings -> system -> display

questions.question_text: A systems administrator is configuring centralized desktop management for computers on a domain. The management team has decided that all users' workstations should have the same network drives, printers, and configurations. Which of the following should the administrator use to accomplish this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
The administrator should use E. Group Policy to accomplish this task. Group Policy is a feature of the Microsoft Windows NT family of operating systems that controls the working environment of user accounts and computer accounts. It provides centralized management and configuration of operating systems, applications, and usersâ€™ settings in an Active Directory environment, which can include network drives, printers, and configurations.

Selected Answer: E
Microsoft's Group Policy Object (GPO) is a collection of Group Policy settings that defines what a system will look like and how it will behave for a defined group of users. Microsoft provides a program snap-in that allows you to use the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
